intro: Hieracium hemschinense, commonly known as the Hemschinen hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and yellowish to reddish flowers that bloom in late summer. Native to the mountainous regions of Europe, particularly in the Alps, it thrives in rocky and alpine habitats. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and has basal leaves that are lance-shaped. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the hawkweed genus, with adaptations suited to cold and harsh environments.
